info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Union, northwestern Pulaski and north central Alexander Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 814 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dongola, or 8 miles south of Jonesboro, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dongola around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tamms. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 10 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
